results.title: Breath death: a tragedy in masks
results.creator_credit: S. Vanderbeek and A Visible Fill'm
results.brief_description: An anti-war collage composed of fleeting black and white visual using a variety of animation techniques. The tone of this experimental film is surreal using sources of images and sounds from the 20th Century, opening with the rhythm from Screamin’ Jay Hawkins’ ‘I Put a Spell on You’. Soundtrack by Jay Watt.

results.title: Breaking silence
results.brief_description: An epidemic number of children endure their early years in confusion and shame as victims of incest and other forms of sexual exploitation. This documentary goes behind the veneer of domestic bliss to study the incidence and effect of incest on families.

results.title: Break down the barriers
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Queensland National Fitness Council and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates how disabled people are breaking down the barriers which, until recently, often precluded their participation in any other than stereotyped recreational activities. Demonstrates such recreational activities as grass skiing, canoeing, lawn and ten pin bowling, swish, rifle shooting, scuba diving, hang gliding, disco and square dancing etc. Commentary by Stan Pretty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Latto, Queensland National Fitness Council and Town and Country Productions

results.title: Breadmaking at Home with Peter Van
results.brief_description: A step-by-step guide to making delicious, nutritious bread, rolls, cheese and onion plaits, yeast buns and cakes in the convenience of your own home.

results.title: Braverman's condensed cream of Beatles
results.brief_description: A history of the Beatles and the 1960’s from the exuberant, youthful days to the socially conscious end of the decade. Kinestatic imagery captures the Beatles in concert, being interviewed, appearing in news reports interspersed with art, collages, animation, photographs and scenes of social and political activity. Excerpts from their films are also effectively intercut, presenting the spirit of the Beatles, the spirit of the times and the lasting imprint on life and culture made by this remarkable group of musicians. (Awards: Atlanta)

results.title: Branching out
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how the four senior branch sections of the Girl Guide Associations - Air, Land, and Sea Rangers and Cadets, provide modern and lively training with popular appeal for the teenage girl. Training includes gliding, rock climbing, flower arranging, pony trekking, boating, music appreciation, hostessing and welfare work. An International Mixed Camp provides the girls wiht an opportunity of mixing with their contemporaries from other countries.

results.title: Boy of Southeast Asia
results.brief_description: Presents Geng, the young son in a typical home and his brother going to school. Shows the countryside of Southeast Asia, its ancient temples, girls fishing in rivers and river boats carrying cargo and passengers. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Boy and a boa
results.creator_credit: Renata Stoia, Lora Hays and Boa Films
results.brief_description: The story of Martin and his pet boa is informative and entertaining. A story of a young boy and his pet boa. The boa gets loose in a library and gives the viewer a snake’s-eye view of the facilities. We are also learning a great deal about snakes and other members of the reptile family.

results.title: Boxes...boxes...boxes
results.creator_credit: Sue Wilson, Robin Dove and Coincidence Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a highschool “art event” at Hyde Park, Sydney. Includes the human sandwich, capturing space in boxes, man’s ordered existence, a 50 foot long piece of weaving, and seeing the environment from a new viewpoint.
